term.name: Occurrence
term.label: Occurrence
term.definition: An existence of an Organism (sensu http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/Organism) at a particular place at a particular time.

term.name: Event
term.label: Event
term.definition: An action that occurs at some location during some time.

term.name: Location
term.label: Location
term.definition: A spatial region or named place.

term.name: Identification
term.label: Identification
term.definition: A taxonomic determination (e.g., the assignment to a taxon).

term.name: Taxon
term.label: Taxon
term.definition: A group of organisms (sensu http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/OBI_0100026) considered by taxonomists to form a homogeneous unit.

term.name: PreservedSpecimen
term.label: Preserved Specimen
term.definition: A specimen that has been preserved.

term.name: Transaction
term.label: Transaction
term.definition: An interaction between two herbaria, e.g. loan or exchange.

term.name: Permit
term.label: Permit
term.definition: A document or certificate giving permission to do something, e.g. collecting.

term.name: MediaItem
term.label: Media Item
term.definition: An image or other digital resource.

term.name: institutionCode
term.label: Institution Code
term.definition: The Index Herbariorum code for the herbarium supplying the record.

term.name: collectionCode
term.label: Collection Code
term.definition: An acronym or code of a collection or source within the institution.
term.comments: May be the same as institutionCode

term.name: modified
term.label: Modified
term.definition: Date and time of the last modification to any component of the record.
term.usage: Must be an ISO 8601:2004(E) date or (preferrably) date and time.

term.name: basisOfRecord
term.label: Basis Of Record
term.definition: Nature of the record

term.name: type
term.label: Type
term.definition: Nature of the resource

term.name: language
term.label: Language
term.definition: Language of the resource
term.usage: Preferrably use an ISO 639-1 two-letter language code, optionally expanded by an ISO 3166 two-letter country code; an ISO 639-2 three-letter language code can be used when no two-letter code is available.
term.comments: For multimedia objects dcterms:language strictly speaking is the language of the resource. Audubon Core has a separate element, ac:metadataLanguage, to transfer the language of the metadata.

term.name: rightsHolder
term.label: Rights Holder
term.definition: [The name of] Owner of the copyright over the resource.

term.name: license
term.label: License
term.definition: URL defining or elaborating on the licence statement.

term.name: informationWithheld
term.label: Information Withheld
term.definition: Additional information that exists, but that has not been shared in the given record.

examples.example: location information not given for endangered species

term.name: dataGeneralizations
term.label: Data Generalizations
term.definition: Actions taken to make the shared data less specific or complete than in its original form. Suggests that alternative data of higher quality may be available on request.

examples.example: Coordinates generalized from original GPS coordinates to the nearest half degree grid cell.

term.name: occurrenceID
term.label: Occurrence ID
term.definition: A globally unique identifier for the collection object record.
term.usage: Preferrably use a UUID. If this is not feasible an identifier can be created based on a unique field in the database, for example the catalogNumber. If doing so, the identifier must be stored in the database and cannot be changed or used for another record.

term.name: catalogNumber
term.label: Catalog Number
term.definition: The unique identifier for each collection object, including the acronym

term.name: recordedBy
term.label: Recorded By
term.definition: The name(s) of the person or persons who made the collection on which this record is based
term.usage: Any valid collector's name, collector's family name (surname) followed by comma and space (", ") then initials (all in uppercase and separated by fullstops).
term.comments: The format of names is not strictly enforced, but when available should be provided in the standard form.

term.name: recordNumber
term.label: Record Number
term.definition: The verbatim collecting number

term.name: preparations
term.label: Preparations
term.definition: List of preparations from a specimen

term.name: otherCatalogNumbers
term.label: Other Catalog Numbers
term.definition: A list of previous or alternate catalog numbers for the same Occurrence.
term.usage: e.g., for the catalogue numbers for exchanged specimens when known or of multisheets.
term.comments: Note - this is a broader definition than implied by the HISPID 3 mapping

term.name: occurrenceRemarks
term.label: Occurrence Remarks
term.definition: Any additional information provided by the collector.
term.usage: This may contain information about the collecting event/gathering, or descriptive information about the organism.
term.comments: Darwin Core maps occurrenceRemarks to abcd://Unit/Notes and eventRemarks to abcd://Unit/Gathering/Remarks, but botanical collecting notes often contain descriptive notes, which relate to a taxon and hence semantically fit better in occurrenceRemarks. At the same time, they fit better in abcd://Unit/Gathering/Notes, to which they were mapped in HISPID 5, in order to distinguish between notes made by the collector in the field and which refer to the Occurrence and annotations that are made in the herbarium and which refer to the PreservedSpecimen, i.e. abcd://Unit/Notes or HISPID Miscellaneous Notes (misc).

term.name: organismQuantity
term.label: Organism Quantity
term.definition: An indication of abundance of the taxon at the collecting locality as recorded by the collector
term.usage: The value should be from "Tansley (1946) scale"
term.comments: organismQuantityType must be delivered alongside this term. Note that this is a considerable deviation from earlier versions of HISPID, where Frequency was a free text field.

term.name: organismQuantityType
term.label: Organism Quantity Type
term.definition: The type of entity to which the number or enumeration value reported for the quantity of organisms in organismQuantity refers

term.name: establishmentMeans
term.label: Establishment Means
term.definition: The process by which the individual(s) represented in the Occurrence became established at the location.

term.name: lifeForm
term.label: Life Form
term.definition: A description of the habit or life form of the specimen on which the collection object is based.

term.name: lifeStage
term.label: Life Stage
term.definition: The life stage of the individual at the time it was collected.

term.name: sex
term.label: Sex
term.definition: The sex of the individual

term.name: reproductiveCondition
term.label: Reproductive Condition
term.definition: Reproductive condition(s) of the individual represented by the collection object.

term.name: associatedTaxa
term.label: Associated Taxa
term.definition: A list of names of taxa and their associations with the Occurrence.
term.comments: The ABCD mapping using the Synecology element can only be used to transfer one association type, 'growingWith'. Host taxa have to be delivered using a MeasurementOrFact. The HISPID 5 free text representation cannot be delivered in this element at all and needs to be delivered as part of habitat.

term.name: associationType
term.label: Association Type
term.definition: Type of association
term.usage: To be used in combination with dwc:Taxon to make up list for associatedTaxa
term.comments: Could potentially be used for dwc:associatedOccurrences as well, in combination with a dwc:Occurrence.

term.name: associatedSequences
term.label: Associated Sequences
term.definition: List of identifiers for sequences associated with the collection object.
term.usage: Use Genbank accession numbers.

term.name: disposition
term.label: Disposition
term.definition: Current state of the specimen with respect to the collection identified by the collectionCode and institutionCode.

term.name: eventID
term.label: Event ID
term.definition: An identifier for the set of information associated with an Event (something that occurs at a place and time).
term.usage: May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set.

term.name: parentEventID
term.label: Parent Event ID
term.definition: An identifier for the broader Event that groups this and potentially other Events.
term.usage: May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set. Must be an existing EventID. Could be used for collecting trips and expeditions.

term.name: habitat
term.label: Habitat
term.definition: Description of the habitat from where the collection object was collected, including geology and soil type, as well as the associated species.

term.name: topography
term.label: Topography
term.definition: A description of the topography of the habitat from which the collection object was collected

term.name: aspect
term.label: Aspect
term.definition: The abbreviated aspect or outlook of the site from which the collection object was gathered.

term.name: geologicalSubstrate
term.label: Geological Substrate
term.definition: The substrate or parent rock material in the habitat from which the collection object was collected.

term.name: substrate
term.label: Substrate
term.definition: The material from which the collection object was collected.

term.name: soil
term.label: Soil
term.definition: Description of the surface soil type from which the collection object was collected.

term.name: vegetation
term.label: Vegetation
term.definition: Description of the vegetation from which the specimen was collected.

term.name: eventDate
term.label: Event Date
term.definition: The date or period when the specimen was collected

term.name: verbatimEventDate
term.label: Verbatim Event Date
term.definition: The verbatim date information of when the specimen was collected

term.name: collectingTrip
term.label: Collecting Trip
term.definition: The collecting trip or expedition where the specimen was collected

term.name: locality
term.label: Locality
term.definition: Description of the locality from where the specimen was collected.

term.name: verbatimLocality
term.label: Verbatim Locality
term.definition: Verbatim locality description
term.usage: Locality should always be delivered; only deliver verbatimLocality if stored separately from the locality.

term.name: continent
term.label: Continent
term.definition: The name of the continent in which the collecting locality is situated.

term.name: country
term.label: Country
term.definition: The name of the country in which the collecting locality is situated
term.comments: This may not reflect the currently political boundaries

term.name: countryCode
term.label: Country Code
term.definition: The standard ISO-3166 code for the country in which the collecting locality is situated.

term.name: stateProvince
term.label: State Province
term.definition: The name of the next smaller administrative region after country in which the collecting locality is situated.

term.name: county
term.label: County
term.definition: The name of the next smaller administrative region after stateProvince in which the collecting locality is situated.

term.name: waterBody
term.label: Water Body
term.definition: The name of the water body in which the Location occurs.

term.name: islandGroup
term.label: Island Group
term.definition: The name of the island group in which the Location occurs.

term.name: island
term.label: Island
term.definition: The name of the island on or near which the Location occurs.

term.name: decimalLatitude
term.label: Decimal Latitude
term.definition: The geographic latitude of the collecting locality

term.name: decimalLongitude
term.label: Decimal Longitude
term.definition: The geodetic longitude of the collecting locality

term.name: geodeticDatum
term.label: Geodetic Datum
term.definition: The ellipsoid, geodetic datum, or spatial reference system (SRS) upon which the geographic coordinates given in decimalLatitude and decimalLongitude are based.
term.usage: Use of EPSG codes is recommended.

term.name: verbatimLatitude
term.label: Verbatim Latitude
term.definition: The verbatim original latitude for the Location
term.usage: The coordinate ellipsoid, geodeticDatum, or full Spatial Reference System (SRS) for these coordinates should be stored in verbatimSRS and the coordinate system should be stored in verbatimCoordinateSystem.

term.name: verbatimLongitude
term.label: Verbatim Longitude
term.definition: The verbatim original longitude for the Location
term.usage: The coordinate ellipsoid, geodeticDatum, or full Spatial Reference System (SRS) for these coordinates should be stored in verbatimSRS and the coordinate system should be stored in verbatimCoordinateSystem.

term.name: verbatimCoordinates
term.label: Verbatim Coordinates
term.definition: The verbatim original geographic coordinates for the Location
term.usage: Use for UTM type coordinates. The coordinate ellipsoid, geodeticDatum, or full Spatial Reference System (SRS) for these coordinates should be stored in verbatimSRS and the coordinate system should be stored in verbatimCoordinateSystem.

term.name: verbatimCoordinateSystem
term.label: Verbatim Coordinate System
term.definition: The spatial coordinate system for the verbatimLatitude and verbatimLongitude or the verbatimCoordinates of the Location.
term.usage: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

term.name: verbatimSRS
term.label: Verbatim SRS
term.definition: The ellipsoid, geodetic datum, or spatial reference system (SRS) upon which coordinates given in verbatimLatitude and verbatimLongitude, or verbatimCoordinates are based
term.usage: Recommended best practice is use the EPSG code as a controlled vocabulary to provide an SRS, if know

term.name: coordinatePrecision
term.label: Coordinate Precision
term.definition: A decimal representation of the precision of the coordinates given in the decimalLatitude and decimalLongitude

term.name: coordinateUncertaintyInMeters
term.label: Coordinate Uncertainty In Meters
term.definition: Estimate of the maximum horizontal distance between the point referenced by the decimalLatitude and decimalLongitude and the actual location the collection took place.
term.comments: Historically many Australian herbaria have used classes to record the uncertainty in meters, for example 0–50 m, 50–1000 m, 1000–10000 m, 10000–25000 m, > 25000 m. The upper limit of these classes is delivered as coordinateUncertainty.

term.name: georeferencedBy
term.label: Georeferenced By
term.definition: Name(s) of person(s), group(s) or organisation(s) who took the georeference of the Location

term.name: georeferenceProtocol
term.label: Georeference Protocol
term.definition: A description of or reference to the methods used to determine the geographic coordinates of the Location.

term.name: georeferencedDate
term.label: Georeferenced Date
term.definition: The date on which the Location was georeferenced.
term.usage: Recommended best practice is to use an encoding scheme, such as ISO 8601:2004(E).

term.name: georeferenceSources
term.label: Georeference Sources
term.definition: A list of maps, gazetteers, or other resources used to georeference the Location, described specifically enough to allow anyone in the future to use the same resource.

term.name: georeferenceVerificationStatus
term.label: Georeference Verification Status
term.definition: A categorical description of the extent to which the georeference has been verified to represent the best possible spatial descript
term.usage: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

term.name: georeferenceRemarks
term.label: Georeference Remarks
term.definition: Notes or comments about the spatial description determination, explaining assumptions made in addition or opposition to the those formalised in the method referred to in georeferenceProtocol.

term.name: nearestNamedPlace
term.label: Nearest Named Place
term.definition: The nearest named place to the collecting locality.
term.comments: We do not want to use this as generalised locality any more. There are still two use cases: (1) a nearest named placed given by a collector when the collecting locality doesn't have a name or is obscure and (2) the place name the georeference is based on when the name of the locality can't be found in any gazetteer. The latter use case probably desrves its own term.

term.name: minimumElevationInMeters
term.label: Minimum Elevation In Meters
term.definition: Elevation or lower value of a range of elevation in metres.

term.name: maximumElevationInMeters
term.label: Maximum Elevation In Meters
term.definition: Higher value of the range of elevation in metres.

term.name: verbatimElevation
term.label: Verbatim Elevation
term.definition: The original description of the elevation as provided by the collector.

term.name: elevationMethod
term.label: Elevation Method
term.definition: Method by which the elevation was determined.

term.name: minimumDepthInMeters
term.label: Minimum Depth In Meters
term.definition: Depth or the lesser of a range of depth below the local surface in metres.

term.name: maximumDepthInMeters
term.label: Maximum Depth In Meters
term.definition: The greater of a range of depths below the local surface in metres.

term.name: verbatimDepth
term.label: Verbatim Depth
term.definition: Verbatim description of the depth, as provided by the collector.

term.name: identificationID
term.label: Identification ID
term.definition: Identifier for the Identification
term.usage: Use of a UUID is recommended.

term.name: identificationQualifier
term.label: Identification Qualifier
term.definition: A brief phrase or standard term to express doubt about an identification.

term.name: identificationQualifierRank
term.label: Identification Qualifier Rank
term.definition: Rank at which the identificationQualifier applies

term.name: nameAddendum
term.label: Name Addendum
term.definition: A suffix added after the scientific name to indicate aggregate taxa or more or less inclusive taxon concepts

term.name: identificationVerificationStatus
term.label: Identification Verification Status
term.definition: Verification status of the identification, or an indication of how reliable the identification is deemed to be.

term.name: identifierRole
term.label: Identifier Role
term.definition: Categorical indicator of the type of contribution made by the determiner.

term.name: identifiedBy
term.label: Identified By
term.definition: The name(s) of people, groups, or organisations who identified the collection object.

term.name: dateIdentified
term.label: Date Identified
term.definition: The date on which the collection object was identified.

term.name: verbatimDateIdentified
term.label: Verbatim Date Identified
term.definition: The verbatim date of the Identification.

term.name: identificationReferences
term.label: Identification References
term.definition: References used for the Identification.

term.name: previousIdentifications
term.label: Previous Identifications
term.definition: Previous identifications of the collection object.
term.usage: It is preferrable to use the repeatable Identification elements in ABCD or the Identification extension in Darwin Core.

term.name: identificationRemarks
term.label: Identification Remarks
term.definition: Any additional comments made by the determiner as part of the Identification.

term.name: typeStatusQualifier
term.label: Type Status Qualifier
term.definition: Standard term to qualify the type status designation.

term.name: typeStatus
term.label: Type Status
term.definition: A list (concatenated and separated) of nomenclatural types (type status, typified scientific name, publication) applied to the subject.

term.name: typeStatus
term.label: Type Status
term.definition: The type of type specimen this specimen is.

term.name: typeForName
term.label: Type For Name
term.definition: The scientific name of which the collection object is a type.

term.name: taxonRank
term.label: Taxon Rank
term.definition: Taxonomic rank of the taxon to which the collection object has been identified.

term.name: kingdom
term.label: Kingdom
term.definition: Full scientific name of the kingdom in which the taxon is classified

term.name: phylum
term.label: Phylum
term.definition: Full scientific name of the phylum in which the taxon is classified

term.name: class
term.label: Class
term.definition: Full scientific name of the class in which the taxon is classified

term.name: order
term.label: Order
term.definition: Full scientific name of the order in which the taxon is classified

term.name: family
term.label: Family
term.definition: Full scientific name of the order in which the family is classified

term.name: genus
term.label: Genus
term.definition: Full scientific name of the order in which the genus is classified

term.name: specificEpithet
term.label: Specific Epithet
term.definition: Species epithet of the scientific name.

term.name: infraspecificEpithet
term.label: Infraspecific Epithet
term.definition: Infraspecific epithet of the scientific name.

term.name: scientificNameID
term.label: Scientific Name ID
term.definition: An identifier for the nomenclatural (not taxonomic) details of a scientific name.

term.name: scientificName
term.label: Scientific Name
term.definition: Full scientific name with authorship

term.name: scientificNameAuthorship
term.label: Scientific Name Authorship
term.definition: Authorship of the scientific name formatted to the conventions of the applicable nomenclatural code.
term.comments: The parsing of the authorship into the authorship of the basionym and of the combination, as ABCD does, is discouraged. Also in ABCD the entire authorship should be delivered in AuthorTeam.

term.name: nomenclaturalCode
term.label: Nomenclatural Code
term.definition: Nomenclatural code under which the scientific name is applied.

term.name: vernacularName
term.label: Vernacular Name
term.definition: A vernacular name assigned to the specimen.
term.comments: Only use when provided by the collector, e.g. when the collection is a result of ethnobotanical study.

term.name: cultivarGroupName
term.label: Cultivar Group Name
term.definition: Cultivar group name
term.usage: Follow the conventions in the ICNCP.

term.name: cultivarName
term.label: Cultivar Name
term.definition: Cultivar name
term.usage: Follow the conventions in the ICNCP.

term.name: tradeDesignation
term.label: Trade Designation
term.definition: Trade designation
term.usage: Follow the conventions in the ICNCP.

term.name: hybridFlag
term.label: Hybrid Flag
term.definition: Flag to indicate whether the plant name refers to a hybrid, graft chimaera or intergrade, without reference to rank.
term.comments: The ABCD and HISPID 5 //Unit/Identifications/Identification/Result/TaxonIdentified/ScientificName/NameAtomised/Botanical/HybridFlag only applies to hybrid names (hybridFlag:"x").

term.name: hybridParent1
term.label: Hybrid Parent1
term.definition: Scientific name of the first parent of a hybrid

term.name: hybridParent2
term.label: Hybrid Parent2
term.definition: Scientific name of the second parent of a hybrid

term.name: miscellaneousRemarks
term.label: Miscellaneous Remarks
term.definition: Any additional information to be transferred pertaining to the collection object.

term.name: exsiccataSeries
term.label: Exsiccata Series
term.definition: Exsiccata series

term.name: exsiccataFascicle
term.label: Exsiccata Fascicle
term.definition: Fascicle in exsiccata series

term.name: exsiccataNumber
term.label: Exsiccata Number
term.definition: Number in exsiccata series

term.name: voucherFor
term.label: Voucher For
term.definition: Term to indicate the collection object has served as a voucher for a special purpose.

term.name: provenanceTypeFlag
term.label: Provenance Type Flag
term.definition: Code to indicate the type of provenance of the cultivated material from which this collection object was taken.
term.usage: Use ITF2 codes

term.name: cultivatedPlantProvenance
term.label: Cultivated Plant Provenance
term.definition: Descriptive and coded information that describes the geographic position from which the source material of the cultivated plant from which the collection object was taken was collected.
term.usage: Preferrably this information is databased and delivered as a related resource, using all relevant elements from the relevant standard; if this is not feasible, the information can be delivered as free text, providing as much detail as possible.

term.name: donor
term.label: Donor
term.definition: The person, business or institution from which the collection object was obtained.

term.name: duplicatesDistributedTo
term.label: Duplicates Distributed To
term.definition: List of institutions replicates have been sent to.
term.usage: Use Index Herbariorum acronyms.

term.name: loanIdentifier
term.label: Loan Identifier
term.definition: The number assigned to the loan by the lending institution.

term.name: loanDestination
term.label: Loan Destination
term.definition: Institution to which the loan is sent.
term.usage: Preferrably an Index Herbriorum acronym is used.

term.name: loanForBotanist
term.label: Loan For Botanist
term.definition: Name(s) of the botanist(s) for whom the loan is intended.

term.name: loanDate
term.label: Loan Date
term.definition: The date the loan is prepared and/or sent.

term.name: loanReturnDate
term.label: Loan Return Date
term.definition: The date the loan is due to be returned.

term.name: permitType
term.label: Permit Type
term.definition: Type of permit.

term.name: permitReferenceNumber
term.label: Permit Reference Number
term.definition: Reference number allocated to the permit by the issuing authority.

term.name: permitIssuedBy
term.label: Permit Issued By
term.definition: Name of the authority by whom the permit was issued.

term.name: permitIssuedTo
term.label: Permit Issued To
term.definition: Name(s) of the person(s) or organisation to whom the permit was issued.

term.name: permitIssuedDate
term.label: Permit Issued Date
term.definition: Date the permit was issued.

term.name: permitValidDate
term.label: Permit Valid Date
term.definition: Date or period for which the permit is valid.

term.name: permitStatus
term.label: Permit Status
term.definition: Status of the permit.

term.name: permitConditions
term.label: Permit Conditions
term.definition: Conditions on the permit, which may affect how the specimens collected under the permit may be used or distributed.

term.name: permitRemarks
term.label: Permit Remarks
term.definition: Any additional comments pertaining to the permit.

term.name: permitLink
term.label: Permit Link
term.definition: The link to an electronic version of the permit.

term.name: creator
term.label: Creator
term.definition: Creator of the media object.

term.name: createDate
term.label: Create Date
term.definition: Date the media object, or its source, was created.

term.name: digitizationDate
term.label: Digitization Date
term.definition: Date the media object was created.

term.name: source
term.label: Source
term.definition: Original source of the media object, if the resource was digitised from a non-digital source.

term.name: title
term.label: Title
term.definition: Title of the media object, including subtitles, if any.

term.name: description
term.label: Description
term.definition: Description of the media resource.

term.name: caption
term.label: Caption
term.definition: Free-form text to be displayed together with (rather than instead of) a media object that is suitable for captions.

term.name: physicalSetting
term.label: Physical Setting
term.definition: The setting of the content represented in the media object

term.name: subjectCategory
term.label: Subject Category
term.definition: Broad subject or context of the media object.

term.name: tag
term.label: Tag
term.definition: Tag or keyword.

term.name: subjectPart
term.label: Subject Part
term.definition: Part of the subject that is imaged.

term.name: subjectOrientation
term.label: Subject Orientation
term.definition: Orientation of the subject represented in the media object with respect to the capturing device.

term.name: captureDevice
term.label: Capture Device
term.definition: Device used to create the media object.

term.name: resourceCreationTechnique
term.label: Resource Creation Technique
term.definition: Information about technical aspects of the creation of the media object.

term.name: relatedResourceID
term.label: Related Resource ID
term.definition: Identifier(s) of related media objects, e.g.different view angles of the same subject.

term.name: mediaItemID
term.label: Media Item ID
term.definition: An arbitrary code that is unique for the resource, with the resource being either a provider, collection, or media item

term.name: subtype
term.label: Subtype
term.definition: Any URI may be used that provides for more specialization than the type. Possible values are community-defined.
term.usage: URI to vocabulary term
term.vocabulary: Drawing, Painting, Logo, Icon, Illustration, Graphic, Photograph, Animation, Film, SlideShow, DesignPlan, Diagram, Map, MusicalNotation, IdentificationKey, ScannedText, RecordedText, RecordedOrganism, TaxonPage, MultimediaLearningObject, VirtualRealityEnvironment, GlossaryPage.

term.name: metadataDate
term.label: Metadata Date
term.definition: Point in time recording when the last modification to metadata (not necessarily the media object itself) occurred.

term.name: providerManagedID
term.label: Provider Managed ID
term.definition: A free-form identifier (a simple number, an alphanumeric code, a URL, etc.) that is unique and meaningful primarily for the data provider.

term.name: available
term.label: Available
term.definition: The date (often a range) that the resource became or will become available.

term.name: hasServiceAccessPoint
term.label: Has Service Access Point
term.definition: Service access point for metadata about this media resource

term.name: rights
term.label: Rights
term.definition: Information about rights held in and over the resource.

term.name: licenseTerms
term.label: License Terms
term.definition: The license statement defining how resources may be used.

term.name: licenseURL
term.label: License URL
term.definition: A URL defining or further elaborating on the license statement (e. g., a web page explaining the precise terms of use).

term.name: licenseLogoURL
term.label: License Logo URL
term.definition: A URL providing access to a logo that symbolizes the License.

term.name: credit
term.label: Credit
term.definition: Attribution statement

term.name: attributionURL
term.label: Attribution URL
term.definition: The URL of the icon or logo image to appear in source attribution.

term.name: attributionLinkURL
term.label: Attribution Link URL
term.definition: The URL where information about ownership, attribution, etc. of the resource may be found.

term.name: funding
term.label: Funding
term.definition: Organizations or individuals who funded the creation of the resource.

term.name: provider
term.label: Provider
term.definition: Person or organization responsible for presenting the media resource.

term.name: subjectCategoryVocabulary
term.label: Subject Category Vocabulary
term.definition: Any vocabulary or formal classification from which terms in the Subject Category have been drawn.

term.name: taxonCoverage
term.label: Taxon Coverage
term.definition: A higher taxon (e. g., a genus, family, or order) at the level of the genus or higher, that covers all taxa that are the primary subject of the resource

term.name: derivedFrom
term.label: Derived From
term.definition: A reference to an original resource from which the current one is derived.

term.name: associatedSpecimenReference
term.label: Associated Specimen Reference
term.definition: A reference to a specimen associated with this resource.
term.usage: This should be in the same form as catalogNumber

term.name: associatedObservationReference
term.label: Associated Observation Reference
term.definition: A reference to an observation associated with this resource.

term.name: accessURI
term.label: Access URI
term.definition: A URI that uniquely identifies a service that provides a representation of the underlying resource. If this resource can be acquired by an http request, its http URL should be given. If not, but it has some URI in another URI scheme, that may be given here.

term.name: format
term.label: Format
term.definition: A string describing the technical format of the resource (file format or physical medium).
term.comments: maybe be more appropriate to use dcterms:format?

term.name: variant
term.label: Variant
term.definition: A URI designating what this Service Access Point provides. Some suggested values are the URIs ac:Thumbnail, ac:Trailer, ac:LowerQuality, ac:MediumQuality, ac:GoodQuality, ac:BestQuality, and ac:Offline. Additional URIs from communities of practice may be introduced.

term.name: furtherInformationURL
term.label: Further Information URL
term.definition: The URL of a Web site that provides additional information about the version of the media resource that is provided by the Service Access Point.
